name: Arkham Asylum
description: A psychiatric hospital for the criminally insane located in Gotham City.

content.title: History
content.body: Arkham Asylum, officially known as Arkham Asylum for the Criminally Insane, was founded by Amadeus Arkham as a treatment facility for patients who were deemed criminally insane. Over the years, it has housed some of Gotham Cityâ€™s most notorious criminals.

content.title: Geography
content.body: Arkham Asylum is situated on the outskirts of Gotham City, near the river. The expansive facility is isolated from the rest of the city, surrounded by dense forests and a high-security perimeter.

content.title: Notable Features
content.body: Arkham Asylum features high-security cells and containment areas, therapy rooms, a medical wing, and an administrative center. It's heavily guarded and fortified to prevent escapes.

content.title: Story Significance
content.body: In 'Batman Begins', Arkham Asylum plays a crucial role as Dr. Jonathan Crane, also known as Scarecrow, utilizes the facility to conduct fear-inducing experiments. It is later used as a staging ground for Ra's al Ghul's plan to unleash a fear toxin upon Gotham City.
